page.title: 09HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: {BAILBROOK HOUSE Designed by Bath architect,John Eveleigh and built in 1790 by Dr.Denham Skeet.May have been built originallly as a{shooting box}for George 1V when he was Prince of Wales. The house,owned privately until this century,was converted into a {mental}hospital.In 1977 it became a {College}for international aeradio engineers. {BATHEASTON HOUSE Present house built by Henry Walters in 1712 on foundations of family home built around 1640.Main front looks south to River Avon.Remained in Walters family until 1868.For some time house suffered from neglect but now restored to former beauty by present owners.
